channel.title: University of Illinois Press Events Calendar
channel.description: This calendar includes book signings, author speaking engagements, and other events promoting the publications of the University of Illinois Press.

item.title: Thomas Faith at the Library of Congress, Washington, DC
item.description: Thomas Faith, author of Behind the Gas Mask will give a book talk at the West Dining Room on the 6th floor of the Madison Building of the Library of Congress.

item.title: Gary Reid at The Masonic Amphitheatre, Clifton Forge, VA
item.description: Gary Reid, author of The Music of the Stanley Brothers will perform his play A Life of Sorrow, the Life and Times of Carter Stanley at The Masonic Amphitheatre.

item.title: Gary Reid at Bent Mountain Center, Bent Mountain, VA
item.description: Gary Reid, author of The Music of the Stanley Brothers will perform his play A Life of Sorrow, the Life and Times of Carter Stanley at The Bent Mountain Center.  More information: info@bentmountaincenter.com

item.title: Koritha Mitchell at Jack, Brooklyn, NY
item.description: Koritha Mitchell, author of Living with Lynching, will participate in a talk back and reading after the dramatic reading of the 1929 lynching play "Safe."

item.title: Stephen Wade at the University of California Santa Cruz, Santa Cruz, CA
item.description: Stephen Wade, author of The Beautiful Music All Around Us: Field Recordings and the American Experience, will make a presentation at the Graduate Colloquium.

item.title: Gary Reid at International Country Music Conference, Nashville, TN
item.description: Gary Reid, author of The Music of the Stanley Brothers will speak at the International Country Music Conference.

item.title: Thomas Gradel and Dick Simpson at Illinois Campaign for Political Reform Forum, Chicago, IL
item.description: Thomas Gradel and Dick Simpson, co-authors of Corrupt Illinois: Patronage, Cronyism, and Criminality will speak and participate a panel presented by the Illinois Campaign for Political Reform.

item.title: Alan Guebert at I Know You Like a Book, Peoria Heights, IL
item.description: Alan Guebert, author of The Land of Milk and Uncle Honey, will sign books at a release event at I Know You Like A Book.

item.title: Cynthia Clampitt at Barnes & Noble, Bismarck, ND
item.description: Cynthia Clampitt, author of Midwest Maize: How Corn Shaped the U.S. Heartland, will speak and sign books at the Southridge Center Barnes & Noble.

item.title: Alan Guebert at Hometown Wine & Spirits, Delavan, IL
item.description: Alan Guebert, author of The Land of Milk and Uncle Honey, will sign books at a release event at Hometown Wine & Spirits.

item.title: Alan Guebert at Morton Public Library, Morton, IL
item.description: Alan Guebert, author of The Land of Milk and Uncle Honey, will deliver a book talk and sign books at the Morton Public Library.

item.title: Cynthia Clampitt at Olivia Public Library, Olivia, MN
item.description: Cynthia Clampitt, author of Midwest Maize: How Corn Shaped the U.S. Heartland, will speak and sign books at the Olivia Public Library.

item.title: Robert Marovich at DePaul University Bookstore, Chicago, IL
item.description: Robert Marovich will sign copies of A City Called Heaven: Chicago and the Birth of Gospel Music and speak at the DePaul University Bookstore.

item.title: Alan Guebert at YWCA, Pekin, IL
item.description: Alan Guebert, author of The Land of Milk and Uncle Honey, will speak and sign books at the YWCA of Pekin.

item.title: Robert Marovich at River Oaks Bookstore, Houston, TX
item.description: Robert Marovich will sign copies of A City Called Heaven: Chicago and the Birth of Gospel Music at River Oaks Bookstore.

item.title: Alan Guebert at Champaign Farmers Market, Champaign, IL
item.description: Alan Guebert, author of The Land of Milk and Uncle Honey, will sign books at Champaign Farmers Market.

item.title: Alan Guebert at Prairie Archives, Springfield, IL
item.description: Alan Guebert, author of The Land of Milk and Uncle Honey, will speak and sign books at Prairie Archives.

item.title: Alan Guebert at Our Town Books, Jacksonville, IL
item.description: Alan Guebert, author of The Land of Milk and Uncle Honey, will speak and sign books at Our Town Books.

item.title: Sonja Williams at National Press Club, Washington, DC
item.description: Sonja D. Williams, author of Word Warrior: Richard Durham, Radio and Freedom, will read discuss her book at the Biographers International Organization Annual Conference.

item.title: Thomas Gradel & Dick Simpson at Printers Row Lit Fest, Chicago, IL
item.description: Thomas Gradel & Dick Simpson, co-authors of Corrupt Illinois: Patronage, Cronyism, and Criminality, will sign books at the University of Illinois Press booth at Printers Row Lit Fest.

item.title: Cynthia Clampitt at Printers Row Lit Fest, Chicago, IL
item.description: Cynthia Clampitt, author of Midwest Maize: How Corn Shaped the U.S. Heartland, will sign books at the University of Illinois Press booth at Printers Row Lit Fest.

item.title: Alan Guebert at Printers Row Lit Fest, Chicago, IL
item.description: Alan Guebert, author of The Land of Milk and Uncle Honey, will sign books In the University of Illinois Press booth at Printers Row Lit Fest.

item.title: Alan Guebert at The Wine Goddess, Evanston, IL
item.description: Alan Guebert, author of The Land of Milk and Uncle Honey, will speak and sign books at The Wine Goddess.

item.title: Alan Guebert at Chester Library, Chester, IL
item.description: Alan Guebert, author of The Land of Milk and Uncle Honey, will speak and sign books at Chester Library.

item.description: Alan Guebert, author of The Land of Milk and Uncle Honey, will speak and sign books at St. John's Lutheran Church.

item.description: Alan Guebert, author of The Land of Milk and Uncle Honey, will speak and sign books at Laborer's International Union Hall.

item.title: Dick Simpson at Nigara Foundation, Chicago, IL
item.description: Dick Simpson co-author of Corrupt Illinois: Patronage, Cronyism, and Criminality will speak and sign books.

item.title: Alan Guebert at Boswell Books, Milwaukee, WI
item.description: Alan Guebert, author of The Land of Milk and Uncle Honey, will sign books at Boswell Books.

item.description: Alan Guebert, author of The Land of Milk and Uncle Honey, will sign books at Arcadia Books.

item.description: Alan Guebert, author of The Land of Milk and Uncle Honey, will sign books at Room of One's Own bookstore.

item.title: Alan Guebert at Raw Deal, Menomonie, WI
item.description: Alan Guebert, author of The Land of Milk and Uncle Honey, will sign books at Raw Deal.

item.title: Alan Guebert at Birchwood Caf√©, Minneapolis, MN
item.description: Alan Guebert, author of The Land of Milk and Uncle Honey, will sign books at Birchwood Café.

item.title: Alan Guebert at University of Northern Iowa, Cedar Falls, IA
item.description: Alan Guebert, author of The Land of Milk and Uncle Honey, will speak and sign books at Center for Energy & Environmental Education, University of Northern Iowa.

item.title: Stephen Wade at the Rocky Ridge Music Center, Estes, CO
item.description: Stephen Wade, author of The Beautiful Music All Around Us: Field Recordings and the American Experience, will perform at the American Roots program launch.

item.title: William and Jane Ann Moore at McLean County Museum of History, Bloomington, IL
item.description: William F. Moore and Jane Anne Moore, authors of Collaborators for Emancipation: Abraham Lincoln and Owen Lovejoy, will speak at the McLean County Museum of History.

item.title: Phil Jamison at Appalachian Stringband Festival, Clifftop, WV
item.description: Phil Jamison, author of Hoedowns, Reels, and Frolics, will be delivering a lecture and demonstration along with calling dances at the Appalachian Stringband Festival.

item.title: Cynthia Clampitt at McLean County Museum of History, Bloomington, IL
item.description: Cynthia Clampitt, author of Midwest Maize: How Corn Shaped the U.S. Heartland, will speak and sign books at the McLean County Museum of History.

item.title: Cynthia Clampitt at Glenview Public Library, Glenview, IL
item.description: Cynthia Clampitt, author of Midwest Maize: How Corn Shaped the U.S. Heartland, will speak at Glenview Library.

item.title: Alan Guebert at Room of Pekin Public Library, Pekin, IL
item.description: Alan Guebert, author of The Land of Milk and Uncle Honey, will speak and sign books at Pekin Public Library.

item.title: Stephen Wade at the American Roots Music Program, Estes, CO
item.description: Stephen Wade, author of The Beautiful Music All Around Us: Field Recordings and the American Experience, will perform and lead multiple events at the American Roots Music Program.

item.description: Stephen Wade, author of The Beautiful Music All Around Us: Field Recordings and the American Experience, will perform and lead multiple events at the American Roots Music Program.

item.title: Marion Jacobson at International Accordion Festival, San Antonio, TX
item.description: Squeeze This! author Marion Jacobson will speak and sign copies of her book at the International Accordion Festival.

item.title: Sonja Williams at Ebony Repertory Theater, Los Angeles, CA
item.description: Sonja D. Williams, author of Word Warrior: Richard Durham, Radio and Freedom, will read discuss her book at the Nate Holden Performing Arts Center, Ebony Repertory Theater.
